channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for NY
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for NY

item.title: Report E-2024090421
item.description:
Report E-2024090421

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-23T09:15:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-19
  • City: MASPETH
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: A. DUIE PYLE INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: While unloading freight from trailer, material handler discovered a plastic drum that had fallen over due to improper preparation for transportation. Apparently, when the drum fell over a small crack developed on the bottom as a result of the drum getting pinched on the pallet it was staged on when it fell over that consequently contributed to the unintentional release. Spilled material was neutralized and cleaned with absorbent and placed into a recovery container as was the cracked drum.

item.title: Report E-2024090422
item.description:
Report E-2024090422

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-23T09:15:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-19
  • City: CASTLETON ON HUDSON
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: A. DUIE PYLE INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: While unloading freight material handler discovered a box that was slightly wet. Further investigation discovered that the box had been punctured by either a forklift forkblade or other freight consequently puncturing an inner plastic bottle contributing to the unintentional release. Spilled material was cleaned with absorbent and placed into a recovery container as was the punctured box and inner receptacle.

item.title: Report E-2024090424
item.description:
Report E-2024090424

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-23T09:15:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-10
  • City: CONGERS
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On September 10, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum of isopropyl alcohol was punctured by a forklift and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. All spilled isopropyl alcohol had evaporated prior to the crew's arrival. One (1) 55-gallon metal drum of isopropyl alcohol was over packed for transport and disposal. Crews transported the over packed drum to the Newburgh (Montgomery) R+L Terminal

item.title: Report X-2024091131
item.description:
Report X-2024091131

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-19T09:21:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-09
  • City: NEW WINDSOR
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: UNDECLARED- UNMARKED PACKAGES IN WHITE PLASTIC. ONE OPENED ON THE BELT REVEALING A BOX MARKED UN1046 COMPRESSED HELIUM. THE BOX HAD HANDLES AS OPENINGS REVEALING THE ACTUAL TANK. 23 PACKAGES TOTAL - ADDTL TR #S - 1ZC1G375YW74441743, 1ZC1G375YW77321484, 1ZC1G375YW67651208, 1ZC1G375YW85170319, 1ZC1G375YW91283436, 1ZC1G375YW88761336, 1ZC1G375YW96349679,1ZC1G375YW46593089, 1ZC1G375YW81064772, 1ZC1G375YW46478838, 1ZC1G375YW45930411, 1ZC1G375YW48378335, 1ZC1G375YW53990225, 1ZC1G375YW45657360, 1ZC1G375YW66651648, 1ZC1G375YW46122613, 1ZC1G375YW89754173, 1ZC1G375YW84951585, 1ZC1G375YW88519321, 1ZC1G375YW65131149, 1ZC1G375YW57512912 AND 1ZC1G375YW95389520.

item.title: Report E-2024090360
item.description:
Report E-2024090360

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-19T09:21:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-19
  • City: MONTGOMERY
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 04:04 EST on 8/23, XPO-XNW contacted ERTS to report a spill of about 2 ounces of "SUPER DIAMOND CLEAR 350" from a 5gal poly pail impacting the shrink wrap of a pallet. The freight was damaged during loading by XAY. The spill was cleaned before notifying ERTS. ERTS generated waste ID: 216296-1 and reported to Chemtrec who provided report number: 2024082300022. ERTS reported the spill to New York DEC and spoke with Operator 57 who provided the report number: 2404850. The waste was staged on site for terminal personnel to manage.
